newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ghana gets good rains but not in main cocoa area.
newsitem.headline: Ghana gets good rains but not in main cocoa area.

text.p: Above average rains in Ghana for the first ten days of May fell mostly outside the main Western cocoa growing region, official weather data show.

Rainfall at 10 weather stations totalled 498 millimetres against a long-term average of 451 mm. But only 17.2 mm of rain fell in the the Western region, which accounts for 60 percent of cocoa production, against a long-term average of 54.8 mm.
About 50 percent of total rainfall fell in cocoa areas yielding together 90 percent of total annual production -- Western region (60 percent), Ashanti (20) and Brong Ahafo (10).

Rains at each regional weather station were - (long-term average in brackets) Accra 10.4 (50.7), Eastern 42.3 (42.9), Central 18.1 (62.3), Western 17.2 (54.8), Volta 32.2 (54.0), Ashanti 157.2 (49.5), Brong Ahafo 78.8 950.2), Northern 93.7 (34.1), Upper West 8.0 (28.6), Upper East 40.4 (23.9). --Matthew Bunce, Abidjan newsroom + 225 21 90 90
